Description: Wheel-made oil-lamp in ring design with three spouts. Wheel-made red-brown, with flattened globular body, two concentric grooves round the filling-hole, no ornament, no handle, and three large, straight-sided nozzles with flat tops and rounded end. Pale brown (Nile silt?) fabric. Red-brown slip. Edge of the nozzle burnt. Fragmentary, missing one nozzle and base.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.57) (Phase 3)
